dialogues.text: The Kid just looks at him -- then returns to his meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll skip to the final argument. (then) More salad, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a peremptory gesture to Felix, who springs forwa to offer the salad bowl to The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shooter will be back dealing  when you start again. He will give  you an occasional helpful card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an argument?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fact. I'm coming to the  argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a fact. I won't let it  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that knife sharp enough? Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix jumps into action again. He moves to The Kid's side reaches into a breast pocket and takes out a switch blade which he clocks open an inch or two from The Kid's neck. is an extremely ugly-looking and menacing weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if it cuts better with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix hands the knife to The Kid, who tries it on his ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very. But it don't cut any ice with  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jams the knife in the table and snaps off the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Not this time. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As The Kid exits Christian is waiting for him. He moves d the corridor, preoccupied. She follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, looks at her  irritated) Why not, for Chris sakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away) You should eat something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, stopping) I've got to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling) It's -- about us. What's going to  happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What's going to happen? What's going  to happen for Chris sake is I'm going  to win the game. (then more softly) You go back to the apartment, honey,  this might take two more days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) If I go, I'm not going back to the  apartment. If I go -- I'm just going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long moment) Well, that's up to you, Christian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a moment longer then moves up the corrido She watches him, then turns. Standing in the open door so distance away are Schlaegel and Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuffling the cards. CAMERA PULLS BACK enough to see his  face as he looks across at The Kid. CAMERA PANS to a CLOS SHOT of The Kid, and then past a couple of spectators,  including Christian and Melba, to Bill, whose eyes are on The Kid. Finally CAMERA PANS back to The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Shooter -- I won't go  for it.

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: Both The Shooter and Bill are aware of a portentous note The Kid's tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shooter's not well. He didn't  want to spoil the game, but he ought  to be resting... He ought to be in  the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got Lady Fingers. Or we can  deal ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. What The Kid's talking  about is nothing. It's just not  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is to me... You want to kill  yourself, do it on your own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lancey looks from The Kid to The Shooter, sensing that th may be something more behind this, but not knowing just w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to go along with that, Shooter.  Lady Fingers! You ready?

dialogues.speaker: LADY FINGERS
dialogues.text: Rising from her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Eddie the Dude said on his  deathbed, I'm as ready as I'll ever  be. (TIME LAPSE)

dialogues.speaker: THE KID AND POKER HAND
dialogues.text: The four cards showing are the ace, ten and two little cl As CAMERA PULLS BACK we also have time to note The Kid's  stake. He is still ahead. Lancey counts out five hundred  dollars from his stake, leaving about thirteen thousand, puts it into a pot that already contains around a thousan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't persuade myself you have the  flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid turns up the jack of clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid pulls in the money. (TIME LAPSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are showing the strain. Perhaps Lancey the most he appears to be consistently losing. Showing are two nin and two odd cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to pay the price to look  at that third nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid turns up another nine and reaches for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caveat emptor. New deck, please. (TIME LAPSE)

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: He shows a pair of eights and two odd cards against Lance pair of queens. He takes another look at his hole card, a we see that it is of no help to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pair of eights bets an even thousand  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: HOBAN AND YELLER
dialogues.text: They are both sitting on the back of the loveseat now. Th binoculars pass from one to the other. Both men are tense over the growing excitement of the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks and my notoriously fallible  instinct tells me the boy is bluffing  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES to the other four remaining spectators:  Christian, Melba, The Shooter and Bill. They are close en to see the cards but too close to discuss them.

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: The kid has almost half the money in front of him now, an is playing with increasing assurance and pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning his cards) I'm not that curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitement in his  voice) The Kid is pushing it and making it  stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES to the other four spectators as they react t The Kid's successful streak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a low voice) He's getting to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it looks that way. Lancey appears old and unsure. The Kid sharp and cold. A young barracuda moving in for the k CAMERA MOVES in close to Christian as she tries to catch Kid's eye. Thinking she has it, she smiles her encouragem

dialogues.speaker: FEATURING THE KID
dialogues.text: He looks right at her and doesn't seem to see her. Lady  Fingers has dealt the first up cards of a new hand, and L is high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And up five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fold.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN
dialogues.text: Amid the growing excitement and tension she is a complete outsider. (TIME LAPSE)

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: The Kid shows two jacks and two odd cards; Lancey a pair aces and two odd cards. Lancey puts about eight hundred  dollars into the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betting the jack isn't there, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid exposes his hidden jack.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTER, BILL AND MELBA
dialogues.text: Greed and an almost vicious satisfaction marks their face as they watch Lancey falter. The Shooter whispers to Bill just loud enough for the girl to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in -- I think he's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christian looks at them, then at The Kid. Hesitates a mom then suddenly gets to her feet and starts for the door. O Melba notices her, and even she doesn't have time to ques her. CAMERA FOLLOWS Christian to the suite entrance, wher she picks up her bag then turns to look back at the table

dialogues.speaker: FEATURING THE KID
dialogues.text: The place where Christian was sitting is right in his lin of vision but he hasn't observed her departure.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN
dialogues.text: She goes on out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second dawn of the contest is near at hand. The room, continuously lived in for so long by so many people, is a shambles of dirty glasses and plates, empty bottles, full wastebaskets and ash trays, and frayed people. At the pok table, Lady Fingers is dealing a new hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jack and a ten. Jack bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES in close enough for us to see the cards. Lan has the jack of hearts, The Kid the ten of clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is willing to wager two hundred  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid takes his first look at his hole card.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWING FACE OF HOLE CARD
dialogues.text: It is the queen of hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And up five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lancey looks at him a long moment. His face pale and shak The Kid is beating him. Pushing -- buying -- always press and Lancey knows he is losing one hand at a time, not bad but consistently and inevitably. His age and fatigue are strong handicap for the long pull. Then his face settles if he had come to a decision. He smiles lightly summoning some last reserve of strength, almost as if he knows this will be the last hand, win or lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call your five hundred and five  hundred more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a brief  hesitation) Call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty to one hundred says Lancey  paired his jacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark it.

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: Lady Fingers deals the ten of diamonds to The Kid, giving him a pair, and the ten of hearts to Lancey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pair of tens. Jack, ten of hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your five hundred -- and up one  thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raise is a surprise. The Kid's eyes go up to study  Lancey's face, even though he knows what a futile effort  that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty to seventy-five he's got the  jacks wired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark it -- Could be a high heart.  Queen's the best, but that old man  can be cocky with an ace or a deuce.  'Specially having one of The Kid's  tens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thousand to the tens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dealing) A third ten, and a nine of hearts to  the ten, jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid, Lancey, Shooter, Melba, Schlaegel, Yeller, Hoban and others as they realize this could be the big hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll run. He's beat on the board  anyway you look at it. Even if he  has the jacks it is better than eight  to one against improving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't run and I don't think he's  got the jacks. I think he's going  for the flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Two thousand, five hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lancey looks at him, then at the cards. The moment stretc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Two thousand, five hundred dollars  to the three hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lancey looks at her. His face briefly showing his anger. Kid notices this and reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, casually) Reasonable bet. Two thousand five  hundred. (he counts out the  money to Lady Fingers) Deal them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing this is it) He's going for it and The Kid's got  him. He's going all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dealing) A queen of diamonds to the three  tens. (a note of excitement  in her voice) And an eight of hearts to the possible  flush. Possible straight flush. Three  tens bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid checks the amount of money in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHOOTER AND BILL
dialogues.text: They exchange a quick look of satisfaction, and then thei eyes go back to the cards.

dialogues.speaker: HOBAN AND YELLER
dialogues.text: They each take a quick turn with the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If The Kid bets into the flush he's  filled up with a queen in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If The Man has a flush or a straight,  he goes under. (then) But not with both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his hole card. It is still the queen of heart He has a full house, which has to be the winning hand unl Lancey had the audacity to bet out with a jack-seven of  hearts, and to raise The Kid with a jack-ten-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet what's in front of me. Make it  fifty-four hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He counts out all his money except a few smaller bills.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATCHERS
dialogues.text: Reacting.

dialogues.speaker: FEATURING LANCEY
dialogues.text: He takes his time before he responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-four hundred bucks is a nice  piece of money. (counting it out) I see the bet and raise sixty-seven  hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly and deliberately, revealing nothing in his face, h reaches into his breast pocket and takes out a slim walle and begins to let the bills flutter out on the table. The Kid looks at him frozen.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHOOTER AND BILL
dialogues.text: Bill hisses softly into The Shooter's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid has him, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But The Shooter, like the Kid, is white-faced and frozen the raise.

dialogues.speaker: THE REMAINING SPECTATORS
dialogues.text: They crowd in close to the table: Hoban, Yeller, Bill, Th Shooter, and Melba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long moment) I'm taking my half hour to raise my  stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I declare a thirty-minute break.  Leave your cards and money on the  table. The game will start again at  five forty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take your marker, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can raise it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long as you know. (he raps the table) -- Call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns up a heart  seven) Straight flush to the jack -- That's  $6700 you owe me, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: There is nothing to be gained from a poker face now, and reacts with a stunned expression in which all the accumul strain and fatigue is beginning to show. CAMERA MOVES amo the spectators: Hoban and Yeller, who are sorry for The K and admiring of Lancey; Bill, who is all the more angry a his defeat because his hopes were up; The Shooter, who is very unhappy man; and Melba, whose anger at the Kid is  balanced by her fear of Schlaegel and what will happen to The Shooter and possibly to her.

dialogues.speaker: THE POKER TABLE
dialogues.text: Lancey pulls in the money while The Kid stares at him dum Lady Fingers riffles the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you playing, Kid? You got a half  an hour to raise your stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (formally) Gentlemen, this game is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one hell of a poker player,  Kid. That was a rough hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the tab for the whole show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he settles up, the CAMERA FOLLOWS The Kid to his brand bottle. As he pours himself a slug, Melba and Shooter joi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to do it, didn't you -- you  had to go for it your own way. (then, as The Kid  doesn't answer) Well, sonny, I hope you learned  something. I know we sure as hell  did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Christian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone. She's got too much sense  to stick with a two bit loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (then:) Sorry, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then:) I should have known he had it, Shooter  Man. I walked into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to grin as  Schlaegel and Felix  move up) Well, Kid, it's like I said -- you  just wasn't ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to The Shooter) Are you ready, Shooter Man? We're  having a meeting and I suggest you  join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooter looks at him a moment and nods, and taking Melba the arm, moves toward the door followed by Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me -- I'm not part of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jerking her forward) Oh, yes you are -- you and your big  mouth -- you're part of it all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, my dear. Now run along  with Felix. We're going to have a  long talk about that big mouth of  yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melba starts to protest, but Felix jerks her out the door Shooter hesitates, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schlaegel turns to The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong. I figured you for brains.  But you're a loser, Kid. You had a  chance to play with grownups and you  ran. (then, as Lancey and  Lady Fingers approach) They weren't playing your game. They  were playing mine. Think about that  while you find a place to hide. But  hide good, Kid -- because I got a  message for you and I'm going to see  it delivered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid looks at him, looks at Lancey and Lady Fingers,  wondering about what Schlaegel has said, angry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schlaegel nods, moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lancey and Lady Fingers join The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd see the day. You  raising tens on a lousy three-flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets down to what it's all about,  doesn't it? Making the wrong play at  the right time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) That's what it's all about? (then, as Lancey looks  at him and doesn't  answer) You were crazy -- odds are three  hundred to one against.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) I don't play a percentage game. I  play stud poker my way. And I got  the money and you got the questions.  Figure that out. (then, not unkindly) You're good. But as long as I'm  around, you're second best, Kid...  and you might as well learn to live  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid looks at him and doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look me up if you're in Miami after  Christmas. Stillson Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles his very pleasant smile and goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Lancey stops surrounded by a crowd of admirers offering t congratulations. The Kid watches for a moment then takes long drink out of the bottle and eases through the crowd out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as The Kid moves down the hall and enters the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he moves through the almost deserted lobby into the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF ANGLES of the Kid walking alone through the cit During the above there is an impression someone is follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns a corner and there is a man blocking his path.  Suddenly three men move in behind him. He turns, trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are four of the original seven players he hustled the opening scene. NOTE: During the progression of the game first one, then  two, then all four men will be included among the observe Always in the background, never positively identified. Th presence should be felt if not recognized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it ain't Eric Stone, from the  foundry. It's the Cincinnati Kid  King of the stud poker players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- not the King -- not much of  anything right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving towards him) We'll start with giving you back  what you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Christian gets out of a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she moves toward  them) Tell her good-bye, sport. You ain't  going any place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to Christian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. (then) Weren't you going to say good-bye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you did. (then) You don't know if I won or lost do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it doesn't really matter. (then after a long  moment) I love you, Kid -- and it's not  enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Listen, Lady, it's coming on the  morning rush. I got to have one fare  after another or I'm behind for the  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christian doesn't answer. She looks at The Kid for a long moment, then turns and goes. He watches her. She enters t cab and it leaves. The Kid just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and the others move up around him. The Kid ignores  them. After a moment Danny swings from behind and knocks to the pavement. He lies there stunned for a moment. They look down at him. Then he comes up. He flattens two in th process of being badly beaten. They leave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the city awakens. Finally, he stirs, stands and walks  away.
